summary: In this context, 1,1,2-trichloroethene is mentioned as a chlorinated volatile organic compound (VOC) used as an industrial solvent, while carbon is referenced in relation to carbon tetra-chloride, another VOC. Both compounds are discussed in the context of air pollution and their negative health impacts. However, there is no direct interaction or specific relationship established between 1,1,2-trichloroethene and carbon beyond their classification as VOCs.
